title: State Climate Action
description: A 60-second lesson on State Climate Action.

hook.text: The federal government stalls on climate. California, New York, and other states don't waitâ€”they write their own laws.

buildup.text: State climate laws include renewable portfolio standards, EV mandates, and emissions reduction targets.

discovery.text: California's cap-and-trade program and New York's Climate Act set aggressive goals: net-zero by 2045 and 2050.

twist.text: State action creates a patchwork. Companies selling nationally must comply with the strictest state's rules.

climax.text: When enough states act, they can drive national changeâ€”even without federal legislation.

punchline.text: States as climate labs. When one leads, others often follow.

quiz.question: What is a renewable portfolio standard?
options: A state requirement for renewable energy in the electricity mix
